text: Wilhelm Maximilian Wundt (August 16 1832â€“ August 31 1920) was a German medical doctor, psychologist, physiologist, and professor. Together with William James, he is regarded as the father of psychology.Butler-Bowdon, Tom. 50 Psychology Classics, (2007): p. 2. In 1879, Wundt founded the one of first formal laboratory for psychological research at the University of Leipzig, and the first journal for psychological research in 1881. == References == Category:1832 births Category:1920 deaths Category:German doctors Category:German psychologists
title: Wilhelm Wundt
